<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">C. Determine Post-DBO Rent for Delta Premises located in the Terminal Cost Center in
accordance with the percentage allocation determined in accordance with the calculations set forth
in Section&nbsp;V.B(2) through (6)&nbsp;above. Based on the Delta Rent Pro Forma and the functional area
utilization assumptions in Table I above, the Post-DBO Rent of each Terminal Functional Area
Requirement for each Terminal Functional Area included in Original Terminal 4 is calculated below.
Note that these Terminal Functional Areas may be in more than one Terminal Sub-Cost Center.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">D. Based on the Delta Rent Pro Forma, Tables K-2 through K-5 show the calculation of Post-DBO
Rent allocable to each Functional Area and within each Terminal Sub-Cost Center included in
Original Terminal 4.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">E. The &#147;<B>Original Terminal 4 Requirement</B>&#148; is the sum of the Requirements for each of the
Airfield Sub-Cost Centers and the Terminal Sub-Cost Centers comprising Original Terminal 4, shown
as the Total of the &#147;Total Requirement&#148; column in Table K-6 below. Then, express the Delta Rent
allocable to Original Terminal 4 as a percentage of the Original Terminal 4 Requirement as shown in
Table K-6 below. The aggregate Delta Rent allocable to Original Terminal 4 expressed as a
percentage of the Original Terminal 4 Requirement is referred to as the &#147;<B>Delta Original Terminal 4
Rent Percentage</B>&#148;.

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">G. When the Percentage Methodology for calculating Delta Rent applies, adjust the Delta Rent
calculated in accordance with the Cost Allocation Methodology as follows: Subtract the Delta
Original Terminal 4 Rent Percentage from the applicable percentage shown in Table L.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;If the result is positive, multiply the Original Terminal 4 Requirement by such percentage
and add the result to the Delta Rent calculated in accordance with the Cost Allocation Methodology
for the applicable period.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;If the result is negative, multiply the Original Terminal 4 Requirement by such percentage
and subtract the result from the Delta Rent calculated in accordance with the Cost Allocation
Methodology for the applicable period.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">H. When the greater of the rent established by the Cost Allocation Methodology or the Percentage
Methodology applies (excluding in each instance any adjustments made in accordance with Section
V.C, above), subtract the Delta Original Terminal 4 Rent Percentage from the applicable percentage
shown in Table L. If the result is a negative number, the Delta Rent shall be calculated by the
Cost Allocation Methodology for the applicable period. If the result is a positive number, then
adjust the Delta Rent calculated in accordance with the Cost Allocation Methodology as stated in
Section&nbsp;VI.G.1 immediately above.
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->-25-<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>



<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>SCHEDULE 7-3(b)</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U><B>Calculation of Terminal 4 Gate Use Fee and Terminal 4 Hardstand Use Fee</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Preliminary Matters:</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The calculations of the Terminal 4 Gate Use Fee and the Terminal 4 Hardstand Use Fee as defined in
this <U>Schedule&nbsp;7-3(b)</U> make reference to certain information, tables, and definitions set
forth in <U>Schedule&nbsp;7-3(a)</U> (Calculation and Payment of Post-DBO Delta Rent) which are based
on current estimates available to the parties, subject to adjustment upon Phase I DBO as described
in <U>Schedule&nbsp;7-3(a)</U>. Capitalized terms used but not defined in the body of the Agreement
shall have the meanings assigned to such terms in <U>Schedule&nbsp;7-3(a)</U> or this <U>Schedule
7-3(b)</U>, as applicable.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" nowrap align="left"><B>I.</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Calculation of &#147;Terminal 4 Gate Use Fee&#148;:</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" nowrap align="left">A.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Determine the Terminal 4 Gate Use Fee as follows:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;Multiply the calculated Cost per Square Foot of Useable Area for the Concourse A, Original
Concourse B, Concourse B Bus Gate, and Phase 1 Concourse B Expansion Terminal Sub-Cost Centers, as
determined in Table F of <U>Schedule&nbsp;7-3(a)</U>, by the holdroom square footage in each respective
Terminal Sub-Cost Center as shown on <U>Annex 7-3</U> of <U>Schedule&nbsp;7-3(a)</U> <U>pages 15</U>
and <U>16</U> to determine the &#147;<B>Gate Holdroom Costs</B>&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;Add from Table C of <U>Schedule&nbsp;7-3(a)</U>, the Total Sub-Cost Center Requirement for
the Original Gate Parking Positions and the Expansion Gate Parking Positions.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;Divide the total costs in subsections A(i) and A(ii) above by the total number of
Original Gate Parking Positions and Expansion Gate Parking Positions (assumed to be 25 after Phase
I DBO) and further divide the resulting quotient by 360 to obtain the &#147;<B>Daily Gate Cost Allocation</B>&#148;.
The Daily Gate Cost Allocation will be divided by the Average Turn Number (defined below)
resulting in the &#147;<B>Terminal 4 Gate Use Fee</B>&#148;, all as illustrated in the table below:
</DIV>
<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD align="left">$</TD>
    <TD align="right">1,309</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">B. As part of the budgeting process, the upcoming Annual Period&#146;s Terminal 4 Gate Use Fee will
be established by determining the average number of turns (rounded to the nearest tenth) per day
per gate during the just-ending fiscal year (annualizing any partial year periods that a gate was
in service), resulting in the &#147;Average Turn Number&#148;. The Terminal 4 Gate Use Fee for the upcoming
Annual Period will be established by dividing the Daily Gate Cost Allocation by the Average Turn
Number.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">C. Where applicable, the Terminal 4 Gate Use Fee will be paid or credited, as the case may be, for
each Turn. A &#147;Turn&#148; means the arrival and departure of an aircraft, excluding returns to ramp not
involving a change of load. Notwithstanding the foregoing, one-half (1/2) of the Terminal 4 Gate
Use Fee will be paid or credited, as the case may be, for aircraft diversions using a Delta Gate or
IAT Gate as appropriate that do not involve the deplanement of passengers or a change of load.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" nowrap align="left"><B>II.</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Calculation of &#147;Terminal 4 Hardstand Use Fee&#148;:</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">A. Add from Table C of <U>Schedule&nbsp;7-3(a)</U>, the Total Sub-Cost Center Requirement for the three
(3)&nbsp;Remote Aircraft Parking Position Sub-Cost Centers set forth in columns 3, 4 and 5 thereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">B Divide the total from Section&nbsp;II.A above by the number of remote Aircraft Parking Positions
(presently 10), and further divide the quotient by 360&nbsp;days per year to result in the &#147;<B>Daily Cost
Per Hardstand Position</B>&#148;. The Daily Cost Per Hardstand Position shall be further divided by 24
hours to obtain the &#147;<B>Hourly Hardstand Cost Allocation</B>&#148;, as shown in the table below:
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>Calculation of Terminal 4 Hourly Hardstand Cost Allocation</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="88%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR></TR>
<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR valign="bottom" style="background: #cceeff">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">Remote Aircraft Parking Positions w/ Fuel Pits</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">$</TD>
    <TD align="right">2,652,799</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">Remote Aircraft Parking Positions Group V</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">$</TD>
    <TD align="right">6,821,484</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">C. The &#147;<B>Terminal 4 Hardstand Use Fee</B>&#148; will be determined by multiplying the Hourly Hardstand Cost
Allocation by the number of hours (counting any partial hour as a complete hour) of each use of a
Hardstand Position subject to the Terminal 4 Hardstand Use Fee pursuant to the terms of the
Agreement.
</DIV>





<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->3<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>SCHEDULE 7-4</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U><B>Definition of &#147;Adjusted Terminal Management Fee&#148;</B></U>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For purposes of this Schedule&nbsp;7-4 only, capitalized terms not otherwise defined herein shall have
the meaning set forth in the JFK IAT Member LLC Agreement (defined below), and the following terms
shall have the following meanings:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<B>Alternative Annual Period</B>&#148; means a twelve-month period (or portion thereof) during the term
of the Port/IAT Lease beginning on December 1 and ending on November&nbsp;30, the first such period
which commenced on the JFK IAT Effective Date.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<B>Base Fee</B>&#148; means the amount for any Semi-Annual Period that would be payable to IAT for such
period (or portion thereof), regardless of whether there is sufficient Available Net Cash Flow to
pay such amount, pursuant to Section&nbsp;8(I)(c)(2) of the Port/IAT Lease as a Subordinated Funding (as
such term is defined in the Port/IAT Lease) in respect of ninety percent (90%) of the Lessee
Terminal Management Funds (as such term is defined in the Port/IAT Lease).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<B>Existing Terminal 4 Square Footage</B>&#148; means 1,536,730 square feet.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<B>JFK IAT Member LLC Agreement</B>&#148; means that certain Second Amended and Restated Limited
Liability Company Agreement of JFK IAT Member, dated as of December &#95;&#95;, 2010, as the same has
heretofore been amended, supplemented or otherwise modified.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<B>JFK IAT Effective Date</B>&#148; means the &#147;Effective Date&#148; as such term is defined in the JFK IAT
Member LLC Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<B>JFK Passengers</B>&#148; means, for any Semi-Annual Period, the &#147;JFK Total Passengers&#148; including
revenue, non-revenue, international and domestic passengers, shown in the Annual Traffic Report for
such period published by the Port Authority.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<B>T3/T4 Passengers</B>&#148; means, for any Semi-Annual Period, all revenue, non-revenue, international,
territorial and domestic passengers, who board or disembark during such period from an aircraft, on
either scheduled or non-scheduled service, at Terminal 3 or Terminal 4.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<B>Terminal 4 Square Footage</B>&#148; means the gross square footage comprising Terminal 4 as existing
from time to time, calculated on a basis consistent with the basis used to calculate the Existing
Terminal 4 Square Footage.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For purposes of this Agreement, &#147;<B>Adjusted Terminal Management Fee</B>&#148; means the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;<U>Semi-Annual Period that includes Phase I DBO</U>. With respect to the Semi-Annual
Period in which Phase I DBO occurs, the portion of such period from and including Phase I DBO and
ending on the day immediately preceding the first day of the Semi-Annual Period commencing on or
after Phase I DBO shall be hereinafter referred to as the &#147;<B>Post DBO Stub Period</B>.&#148; The Adjusted
Terminal Management Fee for the Semi-Annual Period in which Phase I
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->- 1 -<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">DBO occurs shall be an amount
equal to the positive difference between (i)&nbsp;the product of (x)&nbsp;the pro-rata portion of the Base
Fee attributable to the Post DBO Stub Period multiplied by (y)&nbsp;a fraction, the numerator of which is the Terminal 4
Square Footage on the last day of such Semi-Annual Period and the denominator of which is the
Existing Terminal 4 Square Footage, minus (ii)&nbsp;the pro-rata portion of the Base Fee attributable to
the Post DBO Stub Period (the &#147;<B>Stub Period Adjusted Terminal Management Fee</B>&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;<U>Post DBO Semi-Annual Periods</U>. The Adjusted Terminal Management Fee with respect
to the first Semi-Annual Period commencing after Phase I DBO shall be the amount of the Stub Period
Adjusted Terminal Management Fee, semi-annualized to reflect a full one hundred eighty (180)&nbsp;day
period, and, subject to the proviso in clause (b)(ii)(C) below, the Adjusted Terminal Management
Fee with respect to each Semi-Annual Period thereafter shall be the Adjusted Terminal Management
Fee with respect to the immediately preceding Semi-Annual Period, subject in each case to the
following adjustments:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) <U><I>Annual CPI Percentage Increase</I></U>. Effective on the first day of the first
Alternative Annual Period commencing on or after Phase I DBO and thereafter on each
anniversary of such date, the Adjusted Terminal Management Fee with respect to the
Semi-Annual Period commencing on such date shall be increased from the Adjusted Terminal
Management Fee with respect to the immediately preceding Semi-Annual Period by the Annual
CPI Percentage Increase (as defined in the Port/IAT Lease but applied as of the first day
of such Alternative Annual Period and on each anniversary thereof) <U>provided</U>,
<U>however</U>, that, with respect to such adjustment to occur on the first day of the
first Alternative Annual Period commencing on or after Phase I DBO, such Annual CPI
Percentage Increase shall be pro-rated in a manner such that the adjustment will apply only
to the portion of such Alternative Annual Period not covered by the Annual CPI Percentage
Increase applied to the Base Fee pursuant to the Port/IAT Lease.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii) <U><I>Terminal 4 Square Footage Adjustment</I></U>.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A) Effective on the first day of the first Alternative Annual Period
commencing on or after Phase I DBO, the Adjusted Terminal Management Fee with
respect to the Semi-Annual Period commencing on such date (as adjusted pursuant to
clause (b)(i) above) shall be multiplied by a fraction, the numerator of which is
the Terminal 4 Square Footage on the date of Phase I DBO and the denominator of
which is the Existing Terminal 4 Square Footage.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B) If one or more additional material changes to the Terminal 4 Square
Footage occur (each, a &#147;<B>Terminal 4 Square Footage Material Change</B>&#148;) during the Post
DBO Stub Period or any Semi-Annual Period occurring after Phase I DBO, then,
effective on the first day of the next succeeding Semi-Annual Period (the
&#147;<B>Adjustment Date</B>&#148;), an adjustment shall be made for each such change by multiplying
the Adjusted Terminal Management Fee with respect to the Semi-Annual Period
commencing on the Adjustment Date (as adjusted pursuant to clause (b)(i) and
(b)(ii)(A) above) by a fraction, the numerator of which is the Terminal 4 Square
Footage immediately after the Terminal 4 Square Footage
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->- 2 -<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">Material Change and the denominator of which is the Terminal 4 Square Footage
immediately prior to the Terminal 4 Square Footage Material Change;
<U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that, any adjustment pursuant to this clause (B)
shall be made only if such fraction yields a number greater than one (1)&nbsp;unless the
reduction in Terminal 4 Square Footage is due to a permanent reduction in such
space as a result of a casualty, condemnation or similar event, in which case the
adjustment shall be made using such fraction yielding a number less than one (1).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(C) Notwithstanding the foregoing, any adjustment to the Adjusted Terminal
Management Fee for a Semi-Annual Period pursuant to the foregoing clauses (A)&nbsp;or
(B)&nbsp;shall be pro-rated to reflect, in the case of clause (A), the number of days
between the date on which Phase I DBO occurs and the first day of the first
Alternative Annual Period commencing on or after Phase I DBO, and, in the case of
clause (B), the number of days between the date on which any additional Terminal 4
Square Footage Material Change occurs and the applicable Adjustment Date for such
change, in each case relative to a one hundred eighty (180)&nbsp;day period;
<U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that for purposes of determining the Adjusted
Terminal Management Fee with respect to the Semi-Annual Period immediately
succeeding the Semi-Annual Period in which adjustments are made pursuant to clause
(b)&nbsp;above, any adjustment pursuant to the foregoing clauses (A)&nbsp;or (B)&nbsp;shall be
semi-annualized to reflect a one hundred eighty (180)&nbsp;day period.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii) <U><I>JFK Passenger Adjustment</I></U>. Effective on the first day of the second
(2<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">nd</SUP>) Alternative Annual Period commencing after Phase I DBO, the Adjusted
Terminal Management Fee with respect to the Semi-Annual Period commencing on such date (as
adjusted pursuant to clause (b)(i) and (b)(ii) above) shall be multiplied by a fraction,
the numerator of which is the total number of JFK Passengers during the first Alternative
Annual Period commencing on or after Phase I DBO and the denominator of which is the total
number of JFK Passengers during the twelve (12)&nbsp;month period immediately preceding the
first Alternative Annual Period commencing on or after Phase I DBO; <U>provided</U> that
if such fraction yields a number less than 1.0, then such fraction shall equal 1.0, and if
such fraction yields a number greater than 1.02, then such fraction shall equal 1.02.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv) <U><I>T3/T4 Passenger Adjustment</I></U>. Effective on the first day of the third
(3<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">rd</SUP>) Alternative Annual Period commencing after Phase I DBO and thereafter on
each anniversary of such date, the Adjusted Terminal Management Fee with respect to the
Semi-Annual Period commencing on such date (as adjusted pursuant to clause (b)(i) and
(b)(ii) above) shall be multiplied by a fraction, the numerator of which is the total
number of T3/T4 Passengers during the immediately preceding Alternative Annual Period (the
&#147;<B>Latest Year</B>&#148;) and the denominator of which is the total number of T3/T4 Passengers during
the Alternative Annual Period immediately preceding the Latest Year (it being understood
and agreed that such adjustment may be an increase or decrease and, accordingly, may either
increase or decrease the Adjusted Terminal Management
Fee for such period (as adjusted pursuant to clause (b)(i) and (b)(ii) above));
<U>provided,</U> <U>however</U>, that if the total number of T3/T4 Passengers during the
Latest Year represents a decrease
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->- 3 -<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">from the Alternative Annual Period immediately preceding
the Latest Year, and the percentage of such decrease is greater than the percentage
decrease or increase in the total number of JFK Passengers during the Latest Year compared
to the total number of JFK Passengers during the Alternative Annual Period immediately
preceding the Latest Year, then the fraction set forth in this clause (b)(iv) shall be
replaced with a fraction, the numerator of which is the total number of JFK Passengers
during the Latest Year and the denominator of which is the total number of JFK Passengers
during the Alternative Annual Period immediately preceding the Latest Year.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v) <U><I>Partial Semi-Annual Periods</I></U>. If IAT is dissolved or liquidated pursuant
to Article&nbsp;VII of the JFK IAT Member LLC Agreement or otherwise, the Adjusted Terminal
Management Fee for such portion of a Semi-Annual Period during which such dissolution or
liquidation occurs shall be adjusted by multiplying the Adjusted Terminal Management Fee
with respect to such period by a fraction, the numerator of which is the number of days in
such period up to and including the last day with respect to which distributions of
Adjusted Fee Income to SUSA Inc. are to be made pursuant to Article&nbsp;IV of the JFK IAT
Member LLC Agreement and the denominator of which is 180.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;<U><I>Port/IAT Lease Reconciliations</I></U>. In the event IAT or the Port Authority makes any
adjustments, true-ups or other reconciliations to amounts under the Port/IAT Lease that would
affect the amount of the Adjusted Terminal Management Fee calculated pursuant to this Schedule&nbsp;7-4
with respect to any period, IAT and Delta shall promptly make the corresponding adjustment, true-up
or other reconciliation to the Adjusted Terminal Management Fee with respect to such period and any
subsequent periods.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->- 4 -<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>SCHEDULE 8-1</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>Port Authority Rules and Regulations</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">THE PORT AUTHORITY OF NEW YORK AND NEW JERSEY<BR>
AIRPORT RULES AND REGULATIONS

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Issued August&nbsp;4, 2009, pursuant to Article&nbsp;IX of the by-laws of The Port Authority&#146;s of New York
and New Jersey adopted at a meeting of the Board of Commissioners held on July&nbsp;26, 2007, and
amended at a meeting of that body on May&nbsp;22, 2008.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Issued by The Port Authority of New York &#038; New Jersey &#151; Aviation Department.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Together with such Airport bulletins issued from time to time by the Managers as necessary to amend
the Port Authority Rules and Regulations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>SCHEDULE 8-3</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>Terminal 3 Parking Fees</B>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Capitalized terms used but not defined in the body of the Agreement shall have the meanings
assigned to such terms in this <U>Schedule&nbsp;8-3</U>.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The &#147;<B>Terminal 3 Parking Fee</B>&#148; shall be determined by multiplying the amount of time a Contract
Carrier or Other JFK Carrier is utilizing a Terminal 3 Hardstand Position by the applicable
Terminal 3 Hardstand Daily Use Fee or Terminal 3 Hardstand Hourly Use Fee, as appropriate, and
shall be applied as a credit to Post-DBO Rent in accordance with <U>Section&nbsp;8.3</U> of the
Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For purposes of this <U>Schedule&nbsp;8-3</U>, the following definitions shall apply:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Delta Use Carrier</B>&#148; shall mean Delta and Delta Affiliate Carriers which may operate through
arrangements with Delta.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Other JFK Carriers</B>&#148; shall mean Contract Carriers (excluding Delta Use Carriers) and other
Scheduled Aircraft Operators operating at the Airport.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Terminal 3 Additional Rental</B>&#148; means any rental other than Terminal 3 Ground Rental paid by Delta
to the Port Authority from time-to-time under the Terminal 3 Parking Space Permit. This amount
shall exclude fees paid or payable by the Permittee to the Port Authority, independent of the Basic
Fee under the Permit, arising out of or related to the enforcement of the Permit provisions, e.g.,
late fees, audit service fees, legal fees and expenses, etc.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Terminal 3 Capital Charge</B>&#148; means an annual amount determined by amortizing over the lesser of ten
(10)&nbsp;years or the remaining period of permission of the Terminal 3 Parking Space Permit, at the
interest rate of the longest maturity of the Series&nbsp;8 Bonds, the sum of all unreimbursed costs and
expenses incurred by Delta with respect to the design, demolition (of Terminal 3) and construction
of the 2010 Construction Work (as defined in Supplement No.&nbsp;3 to the Port/Delta Lease), excluding
(i)&nbsp;construction of the Terminal 2-4 Pedestrian Connector and costs and expenses relating thereto,
(ii)&nbsp;all underground environmental Remediation of Hazardous Substances, (iii)&nbsp;the demolition of the
Air Train connector and elevator core at Terminal 3, together with any unreimbursed Capital
Expenditures made by Delta with respect to the Terminal 3 Site during the term of the Terminal 3
Parking Space Permit. To the extent any amount is included in the Terminal 3 Capital Charge that
is later reimbursed, the Terminal 3 Capital Charge shall be recalculated prospectively taking into
account the reimbursement amount received. As of the date upon which the Port Authority PFC
application for funding for the 2010 Construction Work is approved, any amount that is to be
reimbursed to the Permittee by Port Authority PFC funds shall be excluded from the Terminal 3
Capital Charge; <U>however</U>, if any of these amounts submitted to the Port Authority for
reimbursement from PFC funds are not reimbursed by the Port Authority then these amounts shall be
included in the Terminal 3 Capital Charge on a prospective basis.
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Sch. 8-3
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Terminal 3 Direct and Indirect O&#038;M Expenses</B>&#148; shall mean Delta&#146;s direct, actual costs for
performing its maintenance and repair obligations pursuant to Special Endorsement 9 of the Terminal
3 Parking Space Permit plus indirect O&#038;M expenses equal to 15% of such amount.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Terminal 3 Deferred Ground Rental</B>&#148; shall mean the Area IB Ground Rental (as defined in the
Port/Delta Lease) paid by Delta to the Port Authority under the Port/Delta Lease excluding, if the
Terminal 3 Site Surrender Date (as defined in the Port/Delta Lease) has not occurred by the end of
the twenty-fourth (24th) month from and including the month in which the Demolition Commencement
Date (as defined in the Port/Delta Lease) occurs, the difference between (1)&nbsp;any amounts accrued
and paid at the Second Deferred Area IB Ground Rental Rate (as defined in the Port/Delta Lease) and
(2)&nbsp;the amounts that would have been accrued and paid at the First Deferred Area IB Ground Rental
Rate (as defined in the Port/Delta Lease) had the Terminal 3 Site Surrender Date (as defined in the
Port/Delta Lease) occurred by the end of the twenty-fourth (24th) month from and including the
month in which the Demolition Commencement Date (as defined in the Port/Delta Lease) occurs.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Terminal 3 Ground Rental</B>&#148; shall mean the Basic Fee (as defined in the Terminal 3 Parking
Space Permit), paid by Delta to the Port Authority under the Terminal 3 Parking Space Permit.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Terminal 3 Hardstand Daily Use Fee</B>&#148; shall be calculated, on a per Terminal 3 Hardstand Position
basis, by allocating the Terminal 3 Hardstand Expenses pro-rata to each of the Terminal 3 Hardstand
Positions and then by dividing the Terminal 3 Hardstand Expenses allocated to each Terminal 3
Hardstand Position by a 360-day year.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Terminal 3 Hardstand Expenses</B>&#148; shall mean, for the applicable year, the total of all Terminal 3
Ground Rental, Terminal 3 Deferred Ground Rental, Terminal 3 Additional Rental, if any, Terminal 3
Direct and Indirect O&#038;M Expenses, and Terminal 3 Capital Charges.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Terminal 3 Hardstand Hourly Use Fee</B>&#148; shall be calculated, per Terminal 3 Hardstand Position,
by dividing the Terminal 3 Hardstand Daily Use Fee by 24 hours per day.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>Terminal 3 Hardstand Position</B>&#148; shall mean the hardstand positions located on the Terminal 3 Site
which are the subject of the Terminal 3 Parking Space Permit.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The pro-forma calculations of the Terminal 3 Hardstand Daily Use Fees and Terminal 3 Hardstand
Hourly Use Fees are illustrated in <U>Exhibit&nbsp;A</U> to Schedule&nbsp;8-3 attached hereto.
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Sch. 8-3
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>EXHIBIT A to Schedule&nbsp;8-3</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>Terminal 3 Hardstand Parking Position Rental Calculation</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#091;see attached&#093;
</DIV>

<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Exh. A to Sch. 8-3
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>



<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;A to Schedule&nbsp;8-3</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>Terminal 3 Hardstand Parking Position Rental Calculation</B>
</DIV>
<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 8pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="20%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>SCHEDULE 36-1</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>Agreements Surviving Execution of this Agreement</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">&#091;NONE&#093;
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>




</BODY>
</HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.10.A
<SEQUENCE>3
<FILENAME>g24877exv10w10wa.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.10.A
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w10wa</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">EXHIBIT 10.10(a)
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>DELTA AIR LINES, INC. </B></U><BR>
<U><B>2011 LONG-TERM INCENTIVE PROGRAM </B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>1. Purpose. </B>The 2011 Long-Term Incentive Program (the &#147;<B>2011 LTIP</B>&#148;) is a long term
incentive program sponsored by Delta Air Lines, Inc. (&#147;<B>Delta</B>&#148; or the &#147;<B>Company</B>&#148;) that is intended to
closely: (a)&nbsp;link pay and performance by providing management employees with a compensation
opportunity based on Delta&#146;s achieving key business objectives; and (b)&nbsp;align the interests of
management employees with the Company&#146;s other employees and stakeholders.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The 2011 LTIP is being adopted under the Delta Air Lines, Inc. 2007 Performance Compensation Plan
(&#147;<B>2007 Performance Plan</B>&#148;). It is subject to the terms of the 2007 Performance Plan and an
individual&#146;s 2011 LTIP Award Agreement (&#147;<B>Award Agreement&#148;</B>).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Capitalized terms that are used but not defined in the 2011 LTIP shall have the meaning ascribed to
them in the 2007 Performance Plan. For purposes of the 2011 LTIP, the definitions of &#147;<B>Good
Reason</B>,&#148; and &#147;<B>Retirement</B>&#148; as set forth in the 2007 Performance Plan are hereby replaced or modified
under Section&nbsp;6 below, and shall apply as set forth in Section&nbsp;6 in lieu of the definitions of
these terms in the 2007 Performance Plan or as modified, as applicable.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>2. Plan Administration</B>. (a)&nbsp;The Personnel &#038; Compensation Committee of the Board of
Directors (the &#147;<B>Committee</B>&#148;) shall be responsible for the general administration and interpretation
of the 2011 LTIP and for carrying out its provisions. The Committee shall have such powers as may
be necessary to discharge its duties hereunder, including, without limitation, the following powers
and duties, but subject to the terms of the 2011 LTIP:
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) authority to construe and interpret the terms of the 2011 LTIP, and to determine
eligibility, awards and the amount, manner and time of payment of any awards hereunder;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii) authority to prescribe forms and procedures for purposes of the 2011 LTIP
participation and distribution of awards; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii) authority to adopt rules and regulations and to take such actions as it deems
necessary or desirable for the proper administration of the 2011 LTIP.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;Any rule or decision by the Committee that is not inconsistent with the provisions of the
2011 LTIP shall be conclusive and binding on all persons, and shall be given the maximum deference
permitted by law.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;Notwithstanding anything contained in the 2007 Performance Plan to the contrary, the
Committee shall not have the authority to increase or decrease the actual payout of any Performance
Award (as defined below) granted to any Participant pursuant to Section 4(b) hereunder.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>3. Individual Award Agreements. </B>Any person offered an Award under the 2011 LTIP will be required
to sign an individual Award Agreement. Execution by such person of his or her Award Agreement will
be a prerequisite to the effectiveness of the Award under the 2011 LTIP and to the person&#146;s
becoming a Participant in the 2011 LTIP.
</DIV>






<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>4. Awards.</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(a)&nbsp;Restricted Stock.</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) <U><I>Award Grant</I></U><I>. </I>A Participant may receive Restricted Stock as specified in
the Participant&#146;s Award Agreement (the &#147;<B>Restricted Stock</B>&#148;).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii) <U><I>Grant Date</I></U><I>. </I>The Grant Date of the Restricted Stock will be determined by
the Committee in accordance with the Company&#146;s Equity Award Grant Policy, as in effect from
time to time, and set forth in a Participant&#146;s Award Agreement.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii) <U><I>Restrictions</I></U><I>. </I>Until the restrictions imposed by this Section 4(a) (the
&#147;<B>Restrictions</B>&#148;) have lapsed pursuant to Section&nbsp;4(a)(iv), (v)&nbsp;or (vi)&nbsp;below, a Participant
will not be permitted to sell, exchange, assign, transfer, pledge or otherwise dispose of
the Restricted Stock and the Restricted Stock will be subject to forfeiture as set forth
below.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv) <U><I>Lapse of Restrictions&#151;Continued Employment</I></U><I>. </I>Subject to the terms of the
2007 Performance Plan and the 2011 LTIP, the Restrictions shall lapse and be of no further
force or effect with respect to one-half of the Shares of Restricted Stock on February&nbsp;1,
2012 (&#147;<B>First Installment Date</B>&#148;) and the remaining one-half on February&nbsp;1, 2013 (&#147;<B>Second
Installment Date</B>&#148;).<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">1</SUP>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v) <U><I>Lapse of Restrictions/Forfeiture upon Termination of Employment</I></U><I>. </I>The
Restricted Stock and the Restrictions set forth in this Section 4(a) are subject to the
following terms and conditions:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A) <I>Without Cause or For Good Reason. </I>Upon a Participant&#146;s Termination of
Employment by the Company without Cause or by the Participant for Good Reason
(including the Termination of Employment of the Participant if he is employed by an
Affiliate at the time the Company sells or otherwise divests itself of such
Affiliate), with respect to any portion of the Restricted Stock subject to the
Restrictions, the Restrictions shall immediately lapse on the Pro Rata RS Portion as
of the date of such Termination of Employment. Upon a Participant&#146;s Termination of
Employment by the Company without Cause or by the Participant for Good Reason, any
Restricted Stock that remains subject to the Restrictions, other than the Pro Rata
RS Portion, shall be immediately forfeited.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<B>Pro Rata RS Portion</B>&#148; means, with respect to any portion of Restricted Stock
that is subject to the Restrictions at the time of a Participant&#146;s Termination of
Employment, the number of Shares with respect to which the Restrictions would have
lapsed on each future Installment Date multiplied by a fraction (i)&nbsp;the numerator of
which is the number of calendar months<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">2</SUP> from the Grant Date to the date
of such Termination of
</DIV>


<DIV align="left">
<DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 16pt; width: 18%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">1</SUP></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If this formula results in any
fractional Share allocation to any Installment Date, the number of Shares with
respect to which the Restrictions lapse on the First Installment Date will be
rounded up, and the number of shares with respect to which the Restrictions
lapse on the Second Installment Date will be rounded down, to the nearest whole
Share so that only full Shares are covered by each Installment Date.</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="font-size: 3pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">2</SUP></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>For purposes of the 2011 LTIP, one calendar
month is calculated from the date of measurement to the same or closest
numerical date occurring during the following month. For example, one calendar
month from January&nbsp;31, 2011 will elapse as of February&nbsp;28, 2011, two months
will elapse on March&nbsp;31, 2011, and so on.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">







<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">Employment, rounded up for any partial month and (ii)&nbsp;the denominator of which
is twelve (12)&nbsp;for the First Installment Date and twenty-four (24)&nbsp;for the Second
Installment Date.<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">3</SUP>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B) <I>Voluntary Resignation. </I>Upon a Participant&#146;s Termination of Employment by
reason of a voluntary resignation (other than for Good Reason or Retirement), any
portion of the Restricted Stock subject to the Restrictions shall be immediately
forfeited.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(C) <I>Retirement. </I>Subject to Section&nbsp;4(a)(v)(F) below, upon a Participant&#146;s
Termination of Employment by reason of Retirement, with respect to any portion of
the Restricted Stock subject to the Restrictions, the Restrictions shall immediately
lapse on the Pro Rata RS Portion as of the date of such Termination of Employment.
Pro Rata RS Portion has the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;4(a)(v)(A) above. Upon a
Participant&#146;s Termination of Employment by reason of Retirement, any Restricted
Stock that remains subject to the Restrictions, other than the Pro Rata RS Portion,
shall be immediately forfeited.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(D) <I>Death or Disability. </I>Upon a Participant&#146;s Termination of Employment due to
death or Disability, the Restrictions shall immediately lapse and be of no further
force or effect as of the date of such Termination of Employment.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(E) <I>For Cause. </I>Upon a Participant&#146;s Termination of Employment by the Company
for Cause, any portion of the Restricted Stock subject to the Restrictions shall be
immediately forfeited.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(F) <I>Retirement-Eligible Participants Who Incur a Termination of Employment for
Other Reasons. </I>If a Participant who is eligible for Retirement is, or would be,
terminated by the Company without Cause, such Participant shall be considered to
have been terminated by the Company without Cause for purposes of the 2011 LTIP
rather than having retired, but only if the Participant acknowledges that, absent
Retirement, the Participant would have been terminated by the Company without Cause.
If, however, the employment of a Participant who is eligible for Retirement is
terminated by the Company for Cause, then regardless of whether the Participant is
considered as a retiree for purposes of any other program, plan or policy of the
Company, for purposes of the 2011 LTIP, the Participant&#146;s employment shall be
considered to have been terminated by the Company for Cause.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi) <U><I>Change in Control</I></U>. Notwithstanding the forgoing and subject to Section&nbsp;5
below, upon a Participant&#146;s Termination of Employment by the Company without Cause or by the
Participant for Good Reason (including the Termination of Employment of the Participant if
he is employed by an Affiliate at the time the Company sells or otherwise divests itself of
such Affiliate) on or after a Change in Control but prior to the second anniversary of such
Change in Control, any Restrictions in effect shall immediately lapse on the date of such
Termination of Employment and be of no further force or effect as of such date.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left">
<DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 16pt; width: 18%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">3</SUP></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If this formula results in any fractional
Share, the Pro Rata RS Portion will be rounded up to the nearest whole
Share.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->3<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vii)&nbsp;<U><I>Dividends</I></U><I>. </I>In the event a cash dividend shall be paid with respect to
Shares at a time the Restrictions on the Restricted Stock have not lapsed, the Participant
shall be eligible to receive the dividend upon the lapse of the Restrictions. The
Restrictions shall apply to any such dividend.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>(b)&nbsp;Performance Awards.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;<U><I>Award Grant</I></U><I>. </I>A Participant may receive a Performance Award for a specified
target cash amount as set forth in the Participant&#146;s Award Agreement (a &#147;<B>Performance
Award</B>&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;<U><I>Grant Date</I></U><I>. </I>The Grant Date of the Performance Award will be determined by
the Committee and set forth in the Participant&#146;s Award Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;<U><I>Payout Criteria and Form of Payment</I></U>. Except as otherwise expressly set
forth in this Section&nbsp;4(b), payment, if any, of a Performance Award will be based on the
following factors as described and defined below: (A)&nbsp;the Cumulative Revenue Growth during
the Performance Period of the Company relative to the Composite Performance of the members
of the Industry Composite Group; (B)&nbsp;the Average Annual Operating Income Margin during the
Performance Period of the Company relative to the Composite Performance of the members of
the Industry Composite Group and (C)&nbsp;Return on Invested Capital during the Performance
Period of the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The payout, if any, of a Performance Award will be made (A)&nbsp;in Shares, calculated based
on the Conversion Formula (as defined below), to each Participant who is employed by the
Company as an executive vice president or more senior officer or holds the position of
general counsel or chief financial officer of the Company (&#147;<B>Executive Officer Participant</B>&#148;)
at the time of such payout; and (B)&nbsp;in cash in all other circumstances.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;<U><I>Definitions</I></U><I>.</I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(A)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><I>In General</I>.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(1)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;<B>Composite Performance</B>&#148; means, for purposes of
determining the total Cumulative Revenue Growth and the total Average
Annual Operating Income Margin of the Industry Composite Group, the
result obtained by treating the members of the Industry Composite Group
as if they were one combined entity.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(2)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The &#147;<B>Conversion Formula</B>&#148; will apply to convert
from cash to Shares the payout, if any, of a Performance Award to a
person who is an Executive Officer Participant at the time of such
payout. First, the cash amount of the payout is calculated in the same
manner as if the payout is being made in cash. Next, the cash amount
is converted into a number of Shares based on the following formula: A
&#247; B, where:</TD>
</TR>



</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->4<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A = the amount of the payout for the Performance Award if it is
paid in cash; and</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B = the closing price of a Share on the New York Stock Exchange
on the later of (1)&nbsp;date that the Committee approves the payouts, if
any, of the Performance Awards to the Executive Officer Participants
following the Committee&#146;s determination of the achievement of the
payout criteria described in Section&nbsp;4(b)(iii) and (2)&nbsp;the third
business day following the date on which the Company publicly
announces its annual financial results if this date is scheduled in
the same month that the Committee approves such payouts, if any.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(3)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;<B>GAAP</B>&#148; means accounting principles generally
accepted in the United States of America.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(4)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;<B>Industry Composite Group</B>&#148; means Air Tran
Holdings, Inc., Alaska Air Group, Inc., AMR Corporation, JetBlue
Airways Corporation, Southwest Airlines Co., United Continental
Holdings, Inc., and US Airways Group, Inc.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(5)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;<B>Performance Period</B>&#148; means the period beginning
on January&nbsp;1, 2011 and ending on and including December&nbsp;31, 2012.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(B)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><I>Cumulative Revenue Growth</I>.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(1)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The &#147;<B>Cumulative Revenue Growth</B>&#148; for Delta and
each member of the Industry Composite Group shall be calculated by
using the subject company&#146;s Total Operating Revenue for the applicable
periods and the following formula: (A &#043; B ) &#247; C, where:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A = Total Operating Revenue for 2011 minus Total Operating
Revenue for 2010;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B = Total Operating Revenue for 2012 minus Total Operating
Revenue for 2011; and</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C = Total Operating Revenue for 2010.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(2)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;<B>Total Operating Revenue</B>&#148; means, subject to
Section&nbsp;4(b)(v)(B) below, the subject company&#146;s total operating revenue
for the applicable periods based on its regularly prepared and publicly
available statements of operations prepared in accordance with GAAP.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(C)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><I>Average Annual Operating Income Margin</I>.</TD>

    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(2)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;<B>Operating Income</B>&#148; means, subject to Section
4(b)(v)(B) below, the
subject company&#146;s consolidated operating income for the applicable
periods based on its regularly prepared and publicly available
statements of operations prepared in accordance with GAAP, but
excluding: (i)&nbsp;any material asset write downs; (ii)&nbsp;gains or losses
with respect to unusual or non-recurring events, including, without
limitation, changes in accounting principles, bankruptcy-related
reorganization items, restructuring charges, merger-related costs,
extinguishment of debt and other out of period adjustments; and (iii)
expenses accrued with respect to any annual broad-based employee
profit sharing plan, program or arrangement.</TD>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #textcolor#; background: #bgcolor#">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>issues or repurchases additional Common Stock for cash during the
Performance Period (but excluding the exercise of any employee stock
option for cash), the Market Value of Equity shall be adjusted to
include the gross cash proceeds of the equity issuance or exclude the
gross cash payments for the equity repurchase, before adjustment for
any applicable fees or charges associated therewith.</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size:6pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

4(b)(v)(B), where:</TD>

    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

lenders or lessors, including any adjustments from the book value to
reflect premiums or discounts that may be amortizing;</TD>

    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">(v) <U><I>Vesting</I></U>.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;<I>General. </I>Subject to the terms of the 2007 Performance Plan and all other
conditions included in any applicable Award Agreement, the Performance Award shall
vest, as described in this Section&nbsp;4(b)(v), as of the end of the Performance Period
to the extent that the Company&#146;s actual performance results meet or exceed Threshold
level with respect to Cumulative Revenue Growth, Average Annual Operating Income
Margin and/or Return on Invested Capital, as applicable and as described below. For
purposes of Cumulative Revenue Growth and Average Annual Operating Income Margin,
the Company&#146;s performance is compared against the Composite Performance of the
Industry Composite Group.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B)&nbsp;<I>Committee&#146;s Authority. </I>In determining the Cumulative Revenue Growth and
the Average Annual Operating Income Margin for Delta and each member of the Industry
Composite Group and the Return on Invested Capital for Delta, the Committee shall
make such adjustments with respect to any subject company as is necessary to ensure
the results are comparable, including, without limitation, differences in accounting
policies (for example, fuel hedging). Without limiting the generality of the
forgoing, the Committee shall (i)&nbsp;make such determinations based on financial data
filed by the subject company with the U.S. Department of Transportation or
otherwise, and (ii)&nbsp;exclude from any calculation any item of gain, loss or expense
to be extraordinary or unusual in nature or infrequent in occurrence.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(C)&nbsp;<I>Impact of Certain Events. </I>A company shall be automatically removed from
the Industry Composite Group in the event that any of the following occur during or
with respect to the Performance Period: (i)&nbsp;such company ceases to maintain or does
not timely prepare publicly available statements of operations prepared in
accordance with GAAP; (ii)&nbsp;such company is not the surviving entity in any merger,
consolidation, or other non-bankruptcy reorganization (or survives only as a
subsidiary of an entity other than a previously wholly owned subsidiary of such
company); (iii)&nbsp;such company sells,
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->7<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">leases, or exchanges all or substantially all of its assets to any other person
or entity (other than a previously wholly owned subsidiary of such company); (iv)
such company is dissolved and liquidated; or (v)&nbsp;more than 20% of such company&#146;s
revenues (determined on a consolidated basis based on the regularly prepared and
publicly available statements of operations of such company prepared in accordance
with GAAP) for any fiscal year of such company are attributable to the operation of
businesses other than such company&#146;s airline business and such company does not
provide publicly available statements of operations with respect to its airline
business that are separate from the statements of operations provided with respect
to its other businesses.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(D)&nbsp;<I>Transactions Between Airlines. </I>To the extent reasonably practicable, in
the event of a merger, consolidation or similar transaction during the Performance
Period between Delta and any other airline, including a member of the Industry
Composite Group, or between any member of the Industry Composite Group and any other
airline, including another member of the Industry Composite Group (an &#147;<B>Airline
Merger</B>&#148;), Cumulative Revenue Growth for the surviving company will be calculated on
a combined basis as if the Airline Merger had occurred on January&nbsp;1, 2010 and
Average Annual Operating Income Margin for such company will be calculated on a
combined basis as if the Airline Merger had occurred on January&nbsp;1, 2011. In
addition, Cumulative Revenue Growth for United Continental Holdings, Inc. will be
calculated on a combined basis as if the merger of a wholly owned subsidiary of UAL
Corporation and Continental Airlines, Inc. had occurred on January&nbsp;1, 2010.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(E)&nbsp;<I>Vesting/Performance Measures. </I>The payment, if any, a Participant will
receive in connection with the vesting of the Performance Award will be based on the
following:
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->8<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>
