    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="2" align="right">&#043;5 </TD>
    <TD nowrap>&nbsp;or more</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Payouts based on Customer Service Performance will be straight-line interpolated when actual
performance results fall above Threshold and below Target or above Target and below Maximum.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;<I>Leadership Effectiveness Performance Measure</I>. The Leadership Effectiveness Performance
measure (applicable to Participants who are Vice Presidents or Senior Vice Presidents (other than
any Executive Officer Participants) for 2011 will be based on an evaluation of whether a
Participant has demonstrated leadership attributes and results during 2011 including, among other
things, supporting diversity, providing talent management, meeting financial budget, and being a
role model for the Rules of the Road. The performance ranges and award payout levels will be
determined by the Committee, subject to Section 4(c) above.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;<I>Individual Performance Measure. </I>The Individual Performance measure (applicable to
Participants who are not officers) is generally determined by each Participant&#146;s Leader Performance
Management evaluation (&#147;<B>LPM</B>&#148;) at the end of 2011. The performance ranges and award payout levels
will be determined by the Committee, subject to Section 4(c) above.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>7. Timing of Award Payments.</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;<I>In General. </I>Subject to Sections 7(b) and 8(a) below, any payouts to a Participant under
the MIP for 2011 will be made in cash, as soon as practicable after (i)&nbsp;the Committee certifies the
achievement of the required Financial Performance, Operational Performance and Customer Service
Performance results and (ii)&nbsp;where applicable, Leadership Effectiveness Performance results have
been determined and an LPM evaluation has been completed, but in no event later than March&nbsp;15,
2012, unless it is administratively impracticable to do so, and such impracticability was
unforeseeable at the end of 2011, in which case such payment shall be made as soon as
administratively practicable after March&nbsp;15, 2012. Further, unless a payout for 2011 under the
Profit Sharing Program occurs after
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->6<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">March&nbsp;15, 2012, any payout under the 2011 MIP will not be made prior to a payout for 2011 under the
Profit Sharing Program; <I>provided, however</I>, if it is determined there will be no payout for 2011
under the Profit Sharing Program, any MIP Awards that are payable based on Operational Performance,
Customer Service Performance, Leader Effectiveness Performance or Individual Performance will be
paid as soon as practicable thereafter, but in no event later than March&nbsp;15, 2012, unless it is
administratively impracticable to do so, and such impracticability was unforeseeable at the end of
2011, in which case such payment shall be made as soon as administratively practicable after March
15, 2012.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;<I>Executive Officer Participants. </I>Payouts under the MIP to Participants who, as
of December&nbsp;31, 2011, are Executive Officer Participants (as such term is defined in Section 4(a)
above) will be subject to the following terms and conditions:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) <U>Payment in Restricted Stock</U>. If there is no payout under the Profit
Sharing Program for 2011, any payout under the MIP to an Executive Officer Participant will
be made in shares of Restricted Stock rather than in cash, with the number of shares of
Restricted Stock being equal to the result of the following formula (&#147;<B>MIP Restricted
Stock</B>&#148;): A &#247; B, where<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">2</SUP>:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">A = the amount of the payout to the Executive Officer Participant under the MIP
had the payout been made in cash; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">B = the closing price of a Share on the New York Stock Exchange on the later of
(1)&nbsp;the date that the Committee approves the payouts, if any, to the Executive
Officer Participants under the MIP following the Committee&#146;s certification of the
achievement of the required performance measures as described in Section 7(a) and
(2)&nbsp;the third business day following the date on which the Company publicly
announces its annual financial results if this date is scheduled in the same month
that the Committee approves such payouts, if any.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii) <U>Lapsing of Restrictions; Forfeiture</U>. Until the restrictions imposed by
this Section&nbsp;7(b)(ii) (the &#147;<B>Restrictions</B>&#148;) have lapsed pursuant to the terms below, an
Executive Officer Participant will not be permitted to sell, exchange, assign, transfer,
pledge or otherwise dispose of the MIP Restricted Stock and the MIP Restricted Stock will
be subject to forfeiture as set forth below.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A) The Restrictions shall lapse and be of no further force or effect on the
earlier of the date (1)&nbsp;there is a payout under the Profit Sharing Program unless,
prior to such payout, the Executive Officer Participant incurs a Disqualifying
Termination of Employment or (2)&nbsp;an Executive Officer Participant incurs a
Qualifying Termination of Employment. The MIP Restricted Stock will be
immediately forfeited if, prior to the lapsing of the Restrictions, the Executive
Officer Participant incurs a Disqualifying Termination of Employment.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left">
<DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 16pt; width: 18%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">2</SUP></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If this formula results in any fractional
share, the MIP Restricted Stock will be rounded up to the nearest whole share.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->7<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">







<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B) &#147;<B>Disqualifying Termination of Employment</B>&#148; means an Executive Officer
Participant&#146;s Termination of Employment by the Company for Cause.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(C) &#147;<B>Qualifying Termination of Employment</B>&#148; means an Executive Officer
Participant&#146;s Termination of Employment (1)&nbsp;by the Company without Cause; or (2)
due to death or Disability.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(D) For purposes of this Section&nbsp;7(b)(ii), if an Executive Officer
Participant incurs a Termination of Employment by reason of (1)&nbsp;a voluntary
resignation (including the Termination of Employment by the Participant if he is
employed by an Affiliate at the time the Company sells or otherwise divests itself
of such Affiliate); or (2)&nbsp;Retirement, the Restrictions shall lapse and be of no
further force or effect on the date there is a payout under the Profit Sharing
Program as if such Executive Officer Participant&#146;s employment had continued
through such date.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(E) For purposes of the MIP, &#147;<B>Retirement</B>&#148; means a Termination of Employment
(other than for Cause or death) either: (1)&nbsp;on or after a Participant&#146;s
62<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">nd</SUP> birthday provided that such Participant has completed at least 5
years service since his or her most recent hire date with the Company (or an
Affiliate or former Affiliate); or (2)&nbsp;on or after a Participant&#146;s 52<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">nd</SUP>
birthday provided that such Participant has completed at least 10&nbsp;years service
since his or her most recent hire date with the Company (or an Affiliate or former
Affiliate).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii) <U>Dividends</U>. In the event a cash dividend shall be paid in respect of
Shares at a time the Restrictions on the MIP Restricted Stock have not lapsed, the
Participant shall be eligible to receive the dividend upon the lapse of the
Restrictions. The Restrictions shall apply to any such dividend.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv) <U>2007 Plan; Written Notice</U>. The MIP Restricted Stock will otherwise be
subject to the terms of the 2007 Plan. In the event any Executive Officer Participant&#146;s
MIP Award is converted to MIP Restricted Stock, such Participant will receive a written
notice of such conversion with the details thereof as soon as practicable after the MIP
Payment Date.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>8. Change in Employment Status.</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;<B>Termination of Employment</B>.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) <I>A Termination Event in 2011&#151;General. </I>Except as expressly set forth in this
Section&nbsp;8, in the event a Participant&#146;s employment with Delta terminates for any reason
prior to the end of the workday on December&nbsp;31, 2011, such Participant will be ineligible
for any award under the MIP. In other words, if a Participant is employed according to
Company records through the end of the workday on December&nbsp;31, 2011, the Participant will
be eligible for any award earned under the MIP for 2011, including, if applicable, MIP
Restricted Stock.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii) <I>Termination on or after January&nbsp;1, 2012. </I>Subject to Section 7(b) above, a
Participant who incurs a Termination of Employment for any reason other
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->8<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">than for Cause on or after January&nbsp;1, 2012 will remain eligible for any unpaid MIP
Award, which award will be paid according to the terms of Section 7(a) above. A
Participant who is terminated by the Company for Cause on or after January&nbsp;1, 2012 will
forfeit any unpaid MIP Award.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii) <I>Pro Rata MIP Payment.</I>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A) <I>Disability or Retirement</I>. This Section&nbsp;8(a)(iii)(A) applies to any
Participant who incurs a Termination of Employment prior to January&nbsp;1, 2012 due to
the Participant&#146;s Disability or Retirement (as such term is defined in Section
7(b)(ii)(D)). Subject to the Participant&#146;s execution of a waiver and release of
claims in a form and manner satisfactory to the Company, such Participant will be
eligible to receive a MIP Award based on an adjusted annual base salary amount,
but otherwise in the same manner, to the same extent and at the same time as the
Participant would have received such MIP Award if such Participant&#146;s employment
had continued through December&nbsp;31, 2011 (<I>i.e.</I>, based on achievement of applicable
performance measures). The most recent LPM prior to the Termination of Employment
will generally apply to the Individual Performance measure, if any, applicable to
the Participant. The Participant&#146;s Annual Base Salary will be the result of the
following formula: X &#215; Y/12, where:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">X = the Participant&#146;s annual base salary as in effect as of the date of
Termination of Employment; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">Y = the number of calendar months the Participant was actively employed
by Delta during 2011 in a MIP-eligible position, rounded up for any
partial month.<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">3</SUP>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B) <I>Termination of Employment Without Cause or Resulting in Benefits under
the Severance Plan</I>. This Section&nbsp;8(a)(iii)(B) applies to any Participant who
incurs a Termination of Employment prior to January&nbsp;1, 2012 due to either (1)&nbsp;a
Termination of Employment by the Company without Cause, or (2)&nbsp;for any other
reason that entitles such Participant to benefits under the Delta Air Lines, Inc.
2009 Officer and Director Severance Plan (the &#147;<B>Severance Plan</B>&#148;). Subject to the
Participant&#146;s execution of a waiver and release of claims in a form and manner
satisfactory to the Company, such Participant will be eligible to receive a MIP
Award based on an adjusted annual base salary amount, but otherwise in the same
manner, to the same extent and at the same time as the Participant would have
received such MIP Award if such Participant&#146;s employment had continued through
December&nbsp;31, 2011 (<I>i.e.</I>, based on achievement of applicable performance measures).
The Participant&#146;s Annual Base Salary will be determined in accordance with the
formula set forth in Section&nbsp;8(a)(iii)(A) above.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left">
<DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 16pt; width: 18%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">3</SUP></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>For purposes of the MIP, one calendar
month is calculated from the date of measurement to the same or closest
numerical date occurring during the following month. For example, one calendar
month from January&nbsp;31, 2011 will elapse as of February&nbsp;28, 2011, two months
will elapse on March&nbsp;31, 2011, and so on.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->9<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">







<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(C) <I>Death</I>. This Section&nbsp;8(a)(iii)(C) applies to any Participant
who incurs a Termination of Employment prior to January&nbsp;1, 2012 due to the
Participant&#146;s death. The Participant&#146;s estate will be eligible to receive a Pro
Rata MIP Payment made in cash as soon as practicable after a Participant&#146;s
Termination of Employment, but in no event later than 2<FONT style="FONT-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="FONT-size: 60%">2</FONT> months following the end
of the year in which the Termination of Employment occurs. &#147;<B>Pro Rata MIP Payment&#148;</B>
means the result of the following formula: W &#215; Z/12, where:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 8%">W = the Participant&#146;s Target MIP Award; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 8%">Z = the number of calendar months the Participant was actively
employed by Delta during 2011 in a MIP-eligible position, rounded
up for any partial month.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;<B>Other Changes in Employment Status</B><I>. </I>The terms of this Section 8(b) shall apply to
circumstances involving new hires, promotions, demotions, transfers or leaves of absence during
2011. After a Participant&#146;s Target MIP Award is determined under this Section&nbsp;8(b), the
appropriate weighting of performance measures will apply to each portion of such Target MIP Award
as set forth in Section&nbsp;5 above. For partial calendar months, the change in employment status will
be considered effective as of the 1<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">st</SUP> day of the month in which there is a change in
status. The end of year LPM will apply to any Individual Performance measure applicable to the
Participant unless the Participant is no longer subject to the LPM process after the change in
employment status, in which case the most recent LPM will apply. Any MIP Awards payable under this
Section 8(b) will be paid at the same time and in the same manner as such awards are paid to active
Participants, subject to Section 7(b) above.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) <I>New Hires. </I>With respect to any individual who becomes employed by Delta as a
grade 8 or any more senior MIP-eligible position during 2011 but after January&nbsp;1, 2011,
such individual will be a Participant in the MIP and will be eligible to receive an award
under the MIP for 2011; <I>provided, </I>that such Participant&#146;s Annual Base Salary will be the
result of the following formula: X &#215; Y/12, where:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">X = the Participant&#146;s annual base salary as of December&nbsp;31, 2011; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">Y = the number of calendar months the Participant was actively employed by Delta
in a MIP-eligible position during 2011, rounded up for any partial month.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii) <I>Promotions. </I>Participants who are either promoted into a MIP-eligible job level
or promoted into a higher level of MIP participation during 2011 will have their Target MIP
Award calculated based on their annual base salary at each MIP-eligible job level (measured
as of the date immediately prior to the date the promotion is considered effective for
purposes of the MIP, if applicable, as described in the first paragraph of Section 8(b)
above, and as of December&nbsp;31, 2011) and the number of calendar months they were employed in
each such capacity, multiplied by the relevant total target award percentage applicable to
their position or positions during the relevant period.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->10<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii) <I>Demotions. </I>Participants who are either demoted to a position that is not
eligible to participate in the MIP or demoted to a lower level of MIP participation during
2011 will have their Target MIP Award calculated based on their annual base salary at each
MIP-eligible job level (measured as of the date immediately prior to the date the demotion
is considered effective for purposes of the MIP, as described in the first paragraph of
Section 8(b) above, and, if applicable, as of December&nbsp;31, 2011) and the number of calendar
months they were employed in each such capacity, multiplied by the relevant total target
award percentage applicable to their position or positions during the relevant period.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv) <I>Transfers and Leaves of Absence. </I>In the event that during 2011 a Participant
transfers employment from Delta to a Delta subsidiary or affiliate that does not
participate in the MIP, other than a transfer to the Delta Community Credit Union (the
&#147;<B>DCCU</B>&#148;), the Participant will forfeit any eligibility for an award under the MIP. Except
as provided under Section&nbsp;8(b)(v) below, any Participant who goes on any type of leave or
who transfers to the DCCU at any time during 2011 will have his Target MIP Award calculated
based on his annual base salary (measured as of the date immediately prior to the date the
transfer or leave is considered effective for purposes of the MIP) and the number of
calendar months he was employed in a MIP-eligible position during 2011, multiplied by the
relevant total target award percentage applicable to his MIP-eligible position.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v) <I>Military Leave. </I>In the event that at any time during 2011 a Participant is on a
Military Leave of Absence, his or her Annual Base Salary shall be equal to the aggregate
annual base salary the Participant received from Delta during 2011 plus any amount of base
salary such Participant would have received had he or she been actively employed by Delta
in any corresponding MIP-eligible position during such leave. <B>&#147;Military Leave of Absence</B>&#148;
means a Participant&#146;s absence from his or her position of employment at any time during
2011 because of service in the uniformed services, as defined under the Uniformed Services
Employment and Reemployment Rights Act of 1994, as amended (&#147;<B>USERRA</B>&#148;); <I>provided, </I>that a
Participant must provide the Company appropriate evidence that his or her absence was due
to service in the uniformed services and the period of such service in order to be
considered to be on a Military Leave of Absence for purposes of the MIP. For purposes of
the MIP, any Participant who is absent due to military service (according to Delta&#146;s
records) as of December&nbsp;31, 2011 and has been on such leave for a cumulative period (during
the period he or she has been employed by Delta) of five years or less, will be presumed to
be on a Military Leave of Absence. Any Participant who is similarly absent due to military
service (based on Delta&#146;s records) and who has been on such leave for a period of more than
five years will not be considered to be on a Military Leave of Absence until he or she
provides appropriate evidence that he or she is entitled to an exception to the five-year
limit on uniformed service as set forth in USERRA.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>9. Treatment of Payments Under Benefit Plans or Programs</B>. MIP payments, which for an Executive
Officer Participant who receives MIP Restricted Stock means the amount of the payout to the
Executive Officer Participant under the MIP had the payout been made in cash, will be considered
as earnings under any benefit plan or program sponsored by Delta only to the extent such payments
are included as earnings under the terms of the specific plan or program; <I>provided</I>, <I>however</I>, that
any MIP payment made to an Executive Officer Participant in MIP Restricted Stock will be considered
as earnings only for purposes of the
</DIV>




<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->11<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Company&#146;s restoration payment program, as in effect from time to time. If such payments are
included, unless otherwise provided in such plan or program, participants will be eligible to
contribute amounts paid under the MIP into such plans in the same manner and to the same extent as
their ordinary compensation and any amounts so contributed will be subject to any applicable
Company contributions and/or matches. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Section&nbsp;9,
any MIP payment received in connection with a Termination of Employment shall not be considered
earnings under any benefit plan or program sponsored by Delta.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>10. Effective Date. </B>The MIP will become effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2011; <B><I>provided however, </I></B>if on
or before the date the Committee adopts the MIP any employee who would otherwise have participated
in the MIP is informed that his or her employment will be terminated by the Company without Cause,
any severance such employee is entitled to receive will be calculated based on the 2010 Management
Incentive Plan as in effect as of December&nbsp;31, 2010.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>11. Amendment. </B>Except as otherwise expressly set forth in this Section and Section&nbsp;14, the terms
of Section&nbsp;14 of the 2007 Plan shall apply to any amendment or termination of the MIP. In addition,
the terms applicable to any Participant will be subject in their entirety to the terms of any offer
letter or other document to which the Participant has agreed. The terms of such offer letter or
other document, if contrary to the terms of the MIP, shall govern the rights of the corresponding
Participant.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>12. Fractions. </B>Any calculation under the MIP that results in a fractional amount will be rounded
up to two decimal points.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>13. Section&nbsp;409A of the Code. </B>Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the MIP, to the extent
that any amount paid hereunder in connection with a Termination of Employment constitutes deferred
compensation under Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, and the
regulations promulgated thereunder (together, &#147;<B>Section&nbsp;409A</B>&#148;) and is paid to a &#147;specified employee&#148;
as defined in Section&nbsp;409A, the payment of such amount will be delayed for six months.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>14. Clawback. </B>Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the MIP and subject to further amendment
of this Section&nbsp;14 to the extent required to be in compliance with any applicable law or regulation
or Delta&#146;s internal clawback policy, as it may be amended from time to time, if the Committee
determines that a vice president or more senior officer level Participant has engaged in fraud or
misconduct that caused, in whole or in part, the need for a required restatement of Delta&#146;s
financial statements filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the Committee will review
all incentive compensation awarded to or earned by such Participant, including, without limitation,
any MIP Award, with respect to fiscal periods materially affected by the restatement and may
recover from the Participant all such incentive compensation to the extent that the Committee deems
appropriate after taking into account the relevant facts and circumstances. Any recoupment
hereunder may be in addition to any other remedies that may be available to Delta under applicable
law, including, disciplinary action up to
and including termination of employment.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->12<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>EXHIBIT A&#151;</B><B><I>DELTA CONNECTION GOALS:</I></B>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Delta Connection&#146;s Operational Performance will be based on the number of times during 2011
that the group of Delta Connection carriers meets or exceeds its monthly operational goals for
completion factor and on-time arrival performance (the &#147;<B>Delta Connection Goals</B>&#148;). The 24
monthly Delta Connection Goals are included on the following tables:
</DIV>

<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">A.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The primary source of reported metrics used to calculate performance will be
performance reports provided by each Delta Connection carrier on a daily basis and
validated by Delta Connection Performance Management.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">B.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All domestic and international Delta Connection carrier system operations subject to
capacity purchase agreements and/or revenue proration agreements will be included in the
performance measures, including the operations of ASA, Chautauqua, Comair, Compass,
Mesaba, Pinnacle, SkyWest and Shuttle America, but excluding any revenue proration
operations with respect to which passenger reservations are not reflected on Delta&#146;s
reservations system (the &#147;<B>Delta Connection Program</B>&#148;). In the event that a carrier enters
or leaves the Delta Connection Program, that carrier&#146;s operations will be included or
excluded from the performance measures as applicable.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">C.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The monthly calculation for completion factor will be as follows:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">1.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Add all Delta Connection scheduled system operations for the month.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">2.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Add all Delta Connection system completed flights for the month
(including flights canceled by one carrier and covered by another via an extra
section, which also includes flights changed to Delta aircraft).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">3.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Divide the result of C.2 by the result of C.1 for a combined Delta
Connection system completion factor.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">D.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The monthly calculation for on-time performance will be as follows:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">1.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Add all Delta Connection completed system operations for the month.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">2.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Add all Delta Connection system on time operations for the month. On
time operations are defined as the number of flights that arrive at the scheduled
destination within 15 minutes of the scheduled arrival time.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">3.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Divide the result of D.2 by the result of D.1 for a combined Delta
Connection system on-time performance measure.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">E.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All calculations will be performed and validated by Delta Connection Performance
Management.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

    <TD style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(1)</SUP></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>References to &#147;Successor&#148; refer to Delta on or after May&nbsp;1, 2007, after
giving effect to (1)&nbsp;the cancellation of Delta common stock issued prior to the effective
date of Delta&#146;s emergence from bankruptcy on April&nbsp;30, 2007; (2)&nbsp;the issuance of new Delta
common stock and certain debt securities in accordance with Delta&#146;s Joint Plan of
Reorganization; and (3)&nbsp;the application of fresh start reporting. References to
&#147;Predecessor&#148; refer to Delta prior to May&nbsp;1, 2007.</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="font-size: 3pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(2)</SUP></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Includes (a) $450&nbsp;million in restructuring and merger-related charges primarily
associated with (i)&nbsp;Northwest and the integration of Northwest operations into Delta and
(ii)&nbsp;asset impairment charges related to the initiative to substantially reduce our 50-seat
aircraft fleet and retired dedicated freighter aircraft and (b) $401&nbsp;million primarily due
to a non-cash loss on extinguishment of debt.
Additionally, interest expense includes $216 million in net debt discount
amortization primarily as a result of adjusting our debt and capital lease
obligations to fair value in purchase accounting upon our merger with Northwest.</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="font-size: 3pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(3)</SUP></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Includes (a) $407&nbsp;million in restructuring and merger-related charges associated
with (i)&nbsp;integrating the operations of Northwest into Delta, including costs related to
information technology, employee relocation and training, and re-branding of aircraft and
stations and (ii)&nbsp;employee workforce reduction programs and (b)&nbsp;an $83&nbsp;million non-cash
loss for the write-off of the unamortized discount on the extinguishment of the Northwest
senior secured exit financing facility. Additionally, interest expense includes $370
million in net debt discount amortization primarily as a result of adjusting our debt and
capital lease obligations to fair value in purchase accounting upon our merger with
Northwest.</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="font-size: 3pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(4)</SUP></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Includes a $7.3&nbsp;billion non-cash charge from an impairment of goodwill and other
intangible assets and $1.1&nbsp;billion in primarily non-cash merger-related charges relating to
the issuance or vesting of employee equity awards in connection with our merger with
Northwest.</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="font-size: 3pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(5)</SUP></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Includes a $1.2&nbsp;billion non-cash gain for reorganization items.</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="font-size: 3pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(6)</SUP></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Includes a $6.2&nbsp;billion non-cash charge for reorganization items and a $310
million non-cash charge associated with certain accounting adjustments.</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="font-size: 3pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">(7)</SUP></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, 2008 and 2006, earnings were not
sufficient to cover fixed charges by $1.6&nbsp;billion, $9.1&nbsp;billion and $7.0&nbsp;billion,
respectively.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>SUBSIDIARIES OF DELTA AIR LINES, INC.<BR>
AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2010</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-31.1
<SEQUENCE>9
<FILENAME>g24877exv31w1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-31.1
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv31w1</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;31.1</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">I, Richard H. Anderson, certify that:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of Delta Air Lines, Inc. (&#147;Delta&#148;) for the
fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact
or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period
covered by this report;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included
in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of Delta as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;Delta&#146;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining
disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and
internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f) and
15d-15(f)) for Delta and have:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and
procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to
Delta, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those
entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control
over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance
regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for
external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;Evaluated the effectiveness of Delta&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in
this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as
of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;Disclosed in this report any change in Delta&#146;s internal control over financial reporting
that occurred during Delta&#146;s most recent fiscal quarter that has materially affected, or is
reasonably likely to materially affect, Delta&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;Delta&#146;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation
of internal control over financial reporting, to Delta&#146;s auditors and the Audit Committee of
Delta&#146;s Board of Directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of
internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect Delta&#146;s
ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a
significant role in Delta&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="52%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="35%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="11%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

    <TD valign="top" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

    <TD width="48%">&nbsp;</TD>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;32</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">February&nbsp;15, 2011
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Securities and Exchange Commission<BR>
450 Fifth Street, N.W.<BR>
Washington, D.C. 20549

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Ladies and Gentlemen:
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The certifications set forth below are hereby submitted to the Securities and Exchange
Commission pursuant to, and solely for the purpose of complying with, Section&nbsp;1350 of Chapter&nbsp;63 of
Title 18 of the United States Code in connection with the filing on the date hereof with the
Securities and Exchange Commission of the Annual Report on Form 10-K of Delta Air Lines, Inc.
(&#147;Delta&#148;) for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 (the &#147;Report&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each of the undersigned, the Chief Executive Officer and the Senior Vice President and Chief
Financial Officer, respectively, of Delta, hereby certifies that, as of the end of the period
covered by the Report:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">1.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>such Report fully complies with the requirements of Section 13(a) of the
Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">2.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material
respects, the financial condition and results of operations of Delta.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
